org.spf4j.test.log.annotations

Annotation Type ExpectLog


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Repeatable(value=ExpectLogs.class)
public @interface ExpectLog
    Annotation to assert log behavior. This annotation will describe a expected log event. If this expected log event will not happen during the unit test execution, the unit test will fail.
    Author:
    Zoltan Farkas
    See Also:
    org.spf4j.test.log.annotations

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String category 
      Class<?> categoryClass 
      long expectationTimeout 
      Level level 
      String messageRegexp 
      int nrTimes 
      TimeUnit timeUnit 

    • Element Detail

      • category

        public abstract String category
        Returns:
        the log category to expect. ("" is the root category).
        Default:
        ""

      • categoryClass

        public abstract Class<?> categoryClass
        Returns:
        the log category to expect. (Void.class is the root category and default).
        Default:
        java.lang.Void.class

      • level

        public abstract Level level
        Returns:
        expected log level.
        Default:
        org.spf4j.log.Level.ERROR

      • messageRegexp

        public abstract String messageRegexp
        Returns:
        regexp of expected log message.
        Default:
        ".*"

      • nrTimes

        public abstract int nrTimes
        Returns:
        nr of times the expectation to be asserted.
        Default:
        1

      • expectationTimeout

        public abstract long expectationTimeout
        Returns:
        the number of TU to wait for a log message after the unit test execution is finished.
        Default:
        0L

      • timeUnit

        public abstract TimeUnit timeUnit
        Returns:
        expectation timeout unit.
        Default:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS
